au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.intf.tests

Class TestConfiguredBatchRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig.control.AbstractBatchRunner
      • au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.intf.tests.TestConfiguredBatchRunner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class TestConfiguredBatchRunner
extends AbstractBatchRunner
    The ConfiguredBatchRunner is an implementation of a AbstractBatchRunner which allows batch control to be setup with just configuration and not code implementation.
    This uses a properties file (config/batch.properties) to store configuration. This is different then the canonical ConfiguredBatchRunner as the final modifier is removed from the BATCH_PROPERTIES field to allow it to be modified in tests.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected boolean init()
        Description copied from class: AbstractBatchRunner
        Sets the required batch control process variables. The variables that should be set in this method are:
        • command - The batch command name executable name.
        • commandArgs - The command line arguments to provide for the command. The arguments are provided in the same order as they are entered into the commandArgs list. NOTE: You should add the fileName field as a parameter for the command since this contains an absolute reference to the uploaded instruction file.
        • workingDirBase - The working directory base for the batch command process. If not set, the default base is the system temporary directory. The base is appended with a new folder to contain the results files from the batch executable (assuming it puts the files in its current working directory.)
        • envMap - Environment variable map for the batch process environment. Additions to this will be appended to the default environment variables.
        Specified by:
        init in class AbstractBatchRunner
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise

      • checkFile

        protected boolean checkFile()
        Description copied from class: AbstractBatchRunner
        Provides a sanity check on the provided batch instruction file. For example, it should check the file extension, file size and/or file magic number. It may also check the file extension and apply a transform. For example, if the extension is .gz, it may used GZIPInputStream to uncompress the file.
        Specified by:
        checkFile in class AbstractBatchRunner
        Returns:
        true if the file passed the sanity check, false otherwise

      • magicNumberTest

        private boolean magicNumberTest()
        Tests if the uploaded instruction file magic number is the same as the configured magic number give by the File_Magic_Number property.
        Returns:
        true if the magic numbers are the same

      • fileSizeTest

        private boolean fileSizeTest()
        Tests if the uploaded instruction file size is smaller that the configured maximum file size given by the Max_File_Size property.
        Returns:
        true if the uploaded instruction file is smaller than the \ configured maximum file size

      • fileExtensionTest

        private boolean fileExtensionTest()
        Tests if the uploaded instruction file extension matches the configured extension given by the File_Extension property.
        Returns:
        true if the file extension matches the configured extension

      • sync

        protected boolean sync()
        Description copied from class: AbstractBatchRunner
        This method is run after completion of the batch control executable and should do cleanup, if needed and file synchronisation to some persistent user accessible store, again if needed. This is provided as a utility with a guarantee that it is run only after the successful completion of the batch control executable.
        Specified by:
        sync in class AbstractBatchRunner
        Returns:
        true if successfully completed
